title.narrative: Strengthening Guyana's Capacity to Effectively Combat Trafficking in Persons and Assist Victims of Trafficking

description.narrative: This project aims to strengthen Guyana’s capacity to combat trafficking in persons (TIP) and to assist victims of sex trafficking and forced labor. The project will provide the Government of Guyana with technical assistance to strengthen legal and policy frameworks, through a review of existing legislation and policies in line with international standards and best practices. The institutionalization of victim-centered investigations and prosecutions will be strengthened, as will the identification and referral of victims of trafficking (VOT) through the development of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). Key stakeholders, including judges, police, prosecutors, law enforcement personnel, front-line officials and civil society will receive specialized training on the SOPs. A partnership will be established with the Guyana Women Miners’ Organisation to create a National Networking Group of civil society stakeholders designed to improve coordination efforts between civil society and government. A ‘Training of Trainers’ will be held on the provision of services to VOT, to help ensure a common standard of care and protection. This approach will also help to ensure sustainable capacity development, by allowing for continued knowledge transfer even after the project. Additionally, a direct assistance fund will be established.

mailing-address.narrative: UN Common House 107-108 Duke Street, Kingston, Georgetown 43175, Guyana

sector.narrative: Facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility
